infos.value: ...What is the meaning of this?
Weren't you listening? I made it clear as day.
I've procured five hundred guns for you to take off my hands.
Out of the question. We can't make use of such a number...
Lord Garvall...we beg your understanding.
Rundall is on the brink of ruin.
I'm well aware of that. I also happen to know that King Jayden is being held captive by Lykeros.
Then, you can appreciate thatâ€”

You can only buy one hundred and fifty of my
guns...
...Indeed. The rebellion is being staged in secrecy.
That's why we only need one hundred and fifty. We trust you can understand.
Heh heh heh...
Does something amuse you?
You've told me the terms that suit you, have you not?
Now, how about I do the same in return?
I'll sell one hundred and fifty of my guns to Rundall...and the other three hundred and fifty to Lykeros.
You fiend...!
N-no, Commander Rhaldor!
...Just try it.
My people have been instructed to tell the king of Lykeros everything if I fail to return with my head on my shoulders.
...I doubt they will want to treat your beloved King Jayden kindly after that.
...Ngh.
...You've made your point. We shall buy your five hundred guns.
B-but...such an amount of gil...
I will find a way to pay it... Even if the cost must be my life.
Heh... That almost brings tears to my eyes.
I expect your discretion with regards to the rebellion.
In the case that word reaches Lykeros...
Don't worry, trust is an arms dealer's number one commodity.
Trust? That's laughable.
Well, each to their own. Now then...let's get down to business.
